item.title: trialr - Bayesian Clinical Trial Designs in R and Stan
item.description:
About this publication

I became aware of Stan whilst working on some Bayesian clinical trial designs. I recall using Monte Carlo integration to resolve six-dimensional integrals to estimate posterior means and thinking that there must be a better way. In fact, there were probably many better ways. However, I doubt any would be as good as Stan, a probabilistic programming language and Hamiltonion Monte Carlo Markov Chain sampler. This manuscript is my first sole-author attempt at research. It was particularly pleasing to implement James Wason and Shaun Seaman's augmented binary method, an approach that will surely feature strongly if we are to wean ourselves off information-light binary response variables. trial is on CRAN.
